information.title: Definition
information.description: Constitutional bodies are organizations that are specifically mentioned in the Constitution of India. They derive their powers and authorities directly from the Constitution.

information.title: Election Commission
information.description: Established under Article 324, it conducts free and fair elections to the Parliament, State Legislatures, and offices of President and Vice-President.

information.title: Union Public Service Commission
information.description: Mentioned in Article 315, it conducts civil service examinations and advises the government on matters of recruitment and disciplinary issues.

information.title: Comptroller and Auditor General
information.description: Provided for in Article 148, it audits all receipts and expenditures of the Government of India and the state governments.

information.title: Finance Commission
information.description: Established under Article 280, it recommends the distribution of tax proceeds between the Centre and the States.

information.title: National Commission for Scheduled Castes
information.description: Mentioned in Article 338, it works for the socio-economic development of Scheduled Castes and to prevent atrocities against them.

quizQuestions.question: Which of the following is NOT a constitutional body?
Under which Article is the Election Commission established?
Which constitutional body is responsible for conducting civil service examinations?
Which Article of the Constitution provides for the Comptroller and Auditor General?
Which constitutional body recommends the distribution of tax proceeds between the Centre and the States?
Constitutional bodies derive their powers directly from the Constitution of India.
The Election Commission is responsible for conducting elections to local bodies.
The Comptroller and Auditor General audits all receipts and expenditures of the Government of India and state governments.
The Finance Commission is a permanent constitutional body.
The National Commission for Scheduled Castes is mentioned in Article 338 of the Constitution.
